questions.question_text: An ISP has an MPLS VPN-based network with 12 PE routers. How many peerings are required between the 12 routers if the engineer has not configured route reflectors?

choices.B: On router R4, remove the mpls ip command on the s/0/0/2 interface.
choices.C: On router R2, configure the mpls ip command on the s/0/0/4 interface.
choices.A: On router R4, configure the mpls label protocol Idp command on all serial interfaces.
choices.D: On router R2, configure the mpls label protocol Idp command on the s/0/0/4 interface.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. MPLS traffic from 192.168.4.0/24 to 192.168.5.0/24 is failing to pass over the link from R4 to R2. The engineer verified that:
• Cisco Express Forwarding is enabled on all routers.
//IMG//
• All routers reach all networks via OSPF.
• MPLS traffic from 192.168.1.0/24 to 192.168.3.0/24 is passing normally over the link from R1 to R2.

Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.A: Under the OSPF configuration on Router 2, add area 2 range 10.44.4.0 255.255.252.0.
choices.C: Under the OSPF configuration on Router 3, add area 2 range 10.44.4.0 255.255.252.0.
choices.B: On Router 3, configure an access list to filter the networks.
choices.D: On Router 2, configure a route map to filter the networks.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer installed a new router (Router 3) at the regional hub running MPLS services for scalability. Router 3 is connected to the 10.44.4.0/24, 10.44.5.0/24, 10.44.6.0/24, and 10.44.7.0/24 subnets. The new router has been configured for OSPF Area 2, and it is advertising the four connected networks. The engineer noticed that the same networks are listed as interarea summary routes, and they are being flooded into each area on the area borders. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Unclear what is the request here. Judging by the answers, probably summarization is expected (which is unrelated to 'interarea summary routes'), and in this case A is correct.
Filtering doesn't seem to make sense here anyway.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct, summarization is done on the ABR

choices.C:
Cisco(config)# segment-routing -

Cisco(config-sr)# traffic-eng -

Cisco(config-sr-te)# policy P1 -
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy)# color 1 end ipv4 1.1.1.1
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy)# autoroute include all
choices.A:
Cisco(config)# segment-routing -

Cisco(config-sr)# traffic-eng -

Cisco(config-sr-te)# policy P1 -
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy)# color 1 end-point ipv4 0.0.0.0
choices.D:
Cisco# configure -

Cisco(config)# segment-routing -

Cisco(config-sr)# traffic-eng -

Cisco(config-sr-te)# policy P1 -
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy)# color 1 end-point
choices.B:
Cisco(config)# segment-routing traffic-eng

Cisco(config-sr-te)# policy P1 -
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy)# color 1 end-point ipv4 1.1.1.1
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy )# autoroute
Cisco(config-sr-te-policy-autoroute)# include all

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is troubleshooting an issue with traffic steering using the color-only automated steering mechanism. BGP is failing to automatically steer traffic into an SR policy with the given color of a route, regardless of the next hop. The Layer 2 configuration is correct, and the physical connection between the devices is working normally. Which additional command sequence must the engineer add to correct the issue?

choices.C: Configure segment-routing sr-prefer prefix-list on AG1 and AG2 router for 10.10.10.10/24.
choices.D: Enable segment-routing Mpls sr-prefer on CR1 and CR2 routers for 10.0.0.0/8.
choices.B: Enable segment-routing Mpls sr-prefer on AG1 and AG2 routers for 10.0.0.0/8.
choices.A: Configure segment-routing sr-prefer prefix-list on CR1 and CR2 routers for 10.20.20.10/24.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A looks correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A service provider has LDP and segment routing running in the network. Mobility traffic is carried through LDP and enterprise traffic is carried through segment routing. Which configuration must be implemented to connect the bank branch with the HUB site on routers?
